description: Cultural context adaptation configuration for MedTranslate AI

general.culturalNotes: Traditional Chinese Medicine views health as a balance of yin and yang, with qi (vital energy) flowing through meridians.

cardiology.description: Cardiology with Traditional Chinese Medicine context
cardiology.culturalNotes: TCM views heart conditions in terms of heart qi, blood, yin, and yang balance.

gastroenterology.description: Gastroenterology with Traditional Chinese Medicine context
gastroenterology.culturalNotes: TCM associates digestive issues with spleen and stomach qi, and emotional factors like liver qi stagnation.

psychiatry.description: Psychiatry with Traditional Chinese Medicine context
psychiatry.culturalNotes: TCM views mental health in terms of shen (spirit) and organ imbalances, particularly liver qi stagnation.

general.culturalNotes: Kampo medicine is a Japanese adaptation of Traditional Chinese Medicine, focusing on herbal formulations.

psychiatry.culturalNotes: Japanese approaches to mental health often incorporate Kampo concepts of ki (energy) balance.

general.culturalNotes: Korean traditional medicine includes unique concepts like Sasang constitutional medicine and culture-bound syndromes like hwa-byung.

psychiatry.culturalNotes: Korean approaches to mental health recognize culture-specific syndromes like hwa-byung (suppressed anger syndrome).

general.culturalNotes: Ayurveda classifies individuals by dosha (vata, pitta, kapha) and views health as balance between these elements.

gastroenterology.culturalNotes: Ayurveda views digestive health in terms of agni (digestive fire) and ama (toxins).

psychiatry.culturalNotes: Ayurveda views mental health through the lens of manas (mind) and dosha imbalances.

general.culturalNotes: Unani medicine is based on the Greek humoral theory adapted to Islamic culture, focusing on mizaj (temperament).

psychiatry.culturalNotes: Islamic medicine views mental health through concepts of nafs (self/soul), qalb (heart), and aql (intellect).

general.culturalNotes: Latin American folk medicine includes concepts like curanderismo and culture-bound syndromes like susto (fright sickness).

psychiatry.culturalNotes: Latin American concepts of mental health include culture-specific syndromes like 'ataque de nervios'.
